result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn H Trotta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Due during period of supervision. Not to be collected until restitution is paid in full. Failure to pay results in entry of civil judgment.

$600 monthly payments towards restitution upon obtaining fulltime employment.  Any payments to be applied toward restitution before any supervision fees are collected. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a). Failure to pay results in entry of civil judgment.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. 
No contact with victim or Port Washington Bank.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Submit to DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Due by payment plan of $50.00 a month beginning 9/15/22. Failure to pay results in entry of civil judgment.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dawn H Trotta

records.addlTxt: 10:18 AM Defendant Dawn H Trotta in court, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Dawn H Trotta.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. State gives recommendation. Court orders VIS unsealed. Plea questionnaire on file. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
Defense request to appear in person.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dawn H Trotta appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Dawn H Trotta.  Counsel submits waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court examines the Defendant as to the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary, and binds the Defendant over for trial.  State files information.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading, and enters not guilty pleas.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No contact with: Port Washington State Bank or its employees.  No contact with: Victim A.B.N.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to leave the state of Wisconsin.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dawn H Trotta appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Dawn H Trotta.  Defendant does qualify for public defender.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives reading.  Court finds probable cause.  State recommends $5,000 cash bail.  Counsel as to bail.  Court sets bail.  Counsel waives time limits and requests date for status on preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
